summary: This document is a grand jury subpoena issued by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to the Airline Reporting Corporation, demanding travel records for Ghislaine Maxwell and three other individuals (names redacted) for two time periods (1994-1998 and July 2019 onward). It includes a request for non-disclosure to preserve the confidentiality of the ongoing criminal investigation into violations including sex trafficking.

persons.name: Geoffrey S. Berman
persons.context: Issued and signed the grand jury subpoena as the United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Listed as an individual for whom the subpoena demands all travel and related records from the Airline Reporting Corporation for specified time periods.

persons.name: Ghislaine Borgerson
persons.context: Listed as an alternate name (a/k/a) for Ghislaine Maxwell in the subpoena rider.

events.title: Grand Jury Appearance Date
events.description: The date by which the Airline Reporting Corporation is commanded to appear before the grand jury or produce the requested records.

events.title: Subpoena Issued
events.description: The date the grand jury subpoena was issued and signed by the U.S. Attorney.

locations: Airline Reporting Corporation, 3000 Wilson Blvd., Suite 300, Arlington, VA 22201

keyFacts: A federal grand jury subpoena was issued to the Airline Reporting Corporation on January 23, 2020, as part of a criminal investigation into suspected felonies including violations of 18 U.S.C. §§ 1591 (sex trafficking), 1594(c), 2422(b) (coercion/enticement), and 371 (conspiracy).
The subpoena specifically demands all records for Ghislaine Maxwell (a/k/a Ghislaine Borgerson) and three other individuals whose names are redacted in the provided text.

The requested records cover two distinct time periods: January 1, 1994, through December 31, 1998, and from July 1, 2019, through the date of service, suggesting investigative interest in both historical and recent travel activity.

The U.S. Attorney's Office requested that the Airline Reporting Corporation voluntarily refrain from disclosing the existence of the subpoena to any third party to preserve the confidentiality of the ongoing investigation.
The document indicates the investigation was active and being pursued by the Southern District of New York under U.S. Attorney Geoffrey S. Berman as of early 2020.
